qas.question: What is another way "Coloureds" can be distinguished from "Blacks"?
What are less common languages spoken?
What types of names do "coloureds" have?
What type of names do "blacks" have?

context: Other than by appearance, "Coloureds" can usually be distinguished from "Blacks" by <a0_0>language<a0_0/>. Most speak <a1_0>Afrikaans or English<a1_0/> as a first language, as opposed to Bantu languages such as <a2_0>Zulu or Xhosa<a2_0/>. They also tend to have more <a3_0>European-sounding names<a3_0/> than <a4_0>Bantu names<a4_0/>.
